title: How 10 IS HEX 5 bytes?
content:
I am stuck in this video. Please solve this issue.

This video is about Encryption and Decryption using  Win32 API.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OQuRwpUTBpQ

In this video 27:07 it's saying "10 IS HEX 5 bytes?" But how?

Please watch  this video to understand?

comments.text: This means 10 is the length of ASCII string in which every char relates a nibble (half byte in hex).
The wording is awkward. He's say that given a hexadecimal string, 10 characters in that string represent 5 bytes.

answers_data.content:
The length of 10 is simply the number of characters selected.
Each hexadecimal digit requires 4 bits (0..F).
So 10 hexadecimal digits take 40 bits (4 bits x 10) or 5 bytes (8 bits x 5).
